--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
>=
 anitabidari wrote:
> > I have heretrix-1.10.2 running on a dual core Linux=
 box with 2.8Ghz
> > cpu's and 8G memory. Heretrix is often running into an=
 Out of Memory
> > error. I dont recall seeing this error with an older ver=
sion of
> > heretrix v1.8 that I had running for quite sometime.
> > 
> > I=
 am running it on a 64 bit machine. And the version of java I am
> > using =
is j2se_jdk_sun-1.5.0.07. I have the heap size set to 3Gigs
> > (-Xmx optio=
n.). Does anyone have any ideas on how to resolve this?
> > Should I try ru=
nning it with a 64 bit JVM, so I can specify a larger
> > heap? 
> 
> Were =
you using the exact same JVM (esp. heap) and Heritrix (esp. 
> Processors a=
nd UriUniqFilter) options in 1.8? How long does it take to 
> OOME?
> 
> A =
problematic issue with our DNS library using an ever-growing
amount of 
> c=
ache memory was resolved between 1.8 and 1.10.2, so I would have 
> expecte=
d fewer OOMEs in long-running crawls, rather than more.
> 
> Some thoughts:=

> 
> (1) Since you have 8GB, a 64bit JVM and larger heap could help --
but=
 it 
> tends not help as much as you think, because 64bit object pointers m=
ean 
> it takes a large heap to hold the same number of objects. (One estim=
ate 
> I've seen not specific to Heritrix's heap: 40% larger heap needed fo=
r 
> same number of 64bit JVM objects.)
> 
> (2) Not all OOMEs are really c=
aused by main heap depletion -- some
other 
> resource/memory-space depleti=
ons also cause OOMEs. Some of these other 
> depletions can be *worsened* b=
y growing a heap closer to an addressing 
> ceiling. If you have a OOME tha=
t's easy to reproduce quickly, you may 
> want to try running under a 1.6 J=
VM -- its OOME errors are more 
> descriptive, and there are other options =
for examining the heap (see 
>
http://java.sun.com/javase/6/webnotes/troubl=
e/TSG-VM/html/memleaks.html#gbywi)

> after the OOME.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> =

> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> > 
> > 
> >
>

Hi Gordon
Per your recommendation=
 I have downloaded 1.6 JVM and am running the
crawl. 3G is a lot of memory.=
 What could be causing Heretrix to take
up more than 3G?
